‚Ä¢ Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, ensuring their OEM advertising campaigns run smoothly.

‚Ä¢ Manage client expectations and provide proactive recommendations to maximize performance and ROI.

‚Ä¢ Conduct regular check-ins and performance reviews, ensuring continuous alignment with client KPIs.

‚Ä¢ Work cross-functionally with internal teams (media buyers, analysts, and creatives) to drive campaign execution and optimization.

OEM Advertising Operations

‚Ä¢ Stay updated on OEM advertising trends and best practices, ensuring clients receive cutting-edge strategies.

Data & Reporting

‚Ä¢ Interpret campaign data, identifying patterns, trends, and areas for optimization.

‚Ä¢ Present data-driven insights to clients in a clear, concise, and actionable manner.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in client success, account management, or advertising operations within mobile marketing, AdTech, or performance marketing.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of OEM advertising (or experience in mobile UA, programmatic, or paid media).

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and relationship-building skills ‚Äì ability to own client relationships and drive business impact.

‚Ä¢ Data-driven mindset with experience in Looker Studio, Google Analytics, or similar analytics tools.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a fast-paced, remote environment, managing multiple clients and priorities simultaneously.

‚Ä¢ Proactive, problem-solving attitude with a passion for mobile growth and digital advertising.

Benefits

‚Ä¢ A fully remote work environment with flexible hours.

‚Ä¢ The opportunity to work with top-tier mobile apps and innovative advertising solutions.

‚Ä¢ A high-growth environment where you can take full ownership of client relationships and scale with the company.

‚Ä¢ A yearly budget dedicated for education and self-improvement

If you‚Äôre passionate about client success, data-driven marketing, and mobile growth, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

At REPLUG, we believe that diversity drives innovation and success. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome applications from all backgrounds, regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, disability, or sexual orientation.

title: Finance Manager @ EWOR (m/f/d)
description:
Are you ready to be part of something big and meaningful? Imagine collaborating with some of Europe‚Äôs brightest tech minds in a dynamic and innovative environment. If this sounds interesting, then this role might be the perfect fit for you!

Who are we?

EWOR is a place where extraordinary people come to unlock access to world-class entrepreneurial education, a network of unicorn founders and top-tier investors, and up to ‚Ç¨500K in venture capital funding.

Our leadership and partners are seasoned entrepreneurs who‚Äôve built and scaled fast-growing companies, including billion-dollar successes like SumUp and Adjust. We‚Äôre committed to helping our talents thrive by sharing real-world experience and insider insights from the startup world.

About the role

As a Finance Manager at EWOR, you will work closely with the Investment team, reporting directly to Florian Huber, one of the Co-Founders of EWOR. In this role you will oversee financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and contribute to the management of our startup portfolio (100+ tech companies in Europe and the US).

With a focus on managing finances within the company, tracking portfolio performance, and executing investments, this role is ideal for a professional with strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of finance and legal frameworks.

As a Finance Manager, you will be responsible for leading key financial functions and ensuring operational excellence across the organization. Your main tasks will include:

  • Handle the execution of investment transactions and manage related documentation and reporting.
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory and legal requirements, including reporting standards and governance.
  • Monitor financial performance of portfolio companies.

Requirements

  • 1-2 years of experience in a similar role, overseeing finance and accounting.
  • Proficient analytical and financial modelling and reporting skills.
  • Familiarity with German/European legal and regulatory requirements, particularly in a venture capital or start-up context preferred.
  • High attention to detail while managing financial operations and documentation.

Benefits

title: Senior Product Manager Architecture Guidance (f/m/d)
description:
SAP LeanIX is seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Product Manager to spearhead the development of our new "Architecture Guidance" domain. You will join an emerging team of talented engineers, a UX designer, and an engineering manager to define, build, and evolve a groundbreaking Data Analytics/AI-powered product feature that provides actionable advice to guide architecture transformation for our customers. This role offers a unique opportunity to define the product's vision, engage deeply with customers, and establish this innovative approach as a core contribution to SAP LeanIX‚Äôs product.

WHAT IS WAITING FOR YOU?

  • Lead the product vision and roadmap for "Architecture Guidance," collaborating with leadership and stakeholders to align with SAP LeanIX‚Äôs strategic objectives.
  • Work closely with customers to understand their architecture transformation challenges, translate their needs into actionable insights, and ensure our product delivers measurable value.
  • Drive product discovery processes, conducting market research, analyzing customer feedback, and collaborating with the UX team to design intuitive and impactful solutions.
  • Leverage cutting-edge AI and data analytics to shape how enterprise architecture insights are derived and delivered to customers.
  • Partner with engineering, analytics, UX, legal, and compliance teams to ensure secure, ethical, and scalable product development.
  • Engage with product marketing and sales to position the product effectively, differentiate it in the market, and communicate its unique value proposition.
  • Act as a catalyst for the team's success, managing the backlog, setting priorities, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality outcomes.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • At least 5 years of experience in a Product Management role, ideally in a B2B SaaS environment, with a focus on data analytics or AI-powered solutions.
  • Familiarity with enterprise architecture or IT landscape transformation is highly desirable but not mandatory.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage deeply with customers, understand their pain points, and translate them into innovative solutions.
  • Comfortable collaborating with engineering teams and understanding technical concepts related to data pipelines, AI/ML, and modern SaaS architectures.
  • Experience working with UX teams to drive prototyping, usability testing, and design decisions.
  • Proficiency in working within agile methodologies and managing cross-functional teams.
  • Strong skills in analytics, market research, and competitive positioning.
  • Excellent written and spoken English, with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.

SAP LeanIX is a market leader for enterprise architecture management (EAM), driving the modernization of IT landscapes and continuous business transformation. Its software-as-a-service solutions empower organizations to create transparency, enabling them to visualize, assess and manage the transition towards their target IT architecture. By offering a data-driven and automated approach enhanced with AI, SAP LeanIX helps organizations make sound decisions and collaborate more effectively. SAP LeanIX serves over 1.400 companies globally across various industries, including more than 10% of the Fortune 500 and half of the German DAX 40. Headquartered in Bonn, and offices in Munich and Berlin (Germany), SAP LeanIX also has a strong international presence with offices in Boston (USA), London (UK), Paris (France), Amsterdam (Netherlands), and Ljubljana (Slovenia). In November 2023, LeanIX became part of SAP. For more information, visit . Your application information might be therefore shared across both SAP and SAP LeanIX recruiting and hiring teams.

SAP LeanIX is not just a product, in fact it‚Äòs a great place to work. Colleagues (700+) from dozens of countries jointly make our vision reality. We believe in transparent communication, personal development, diverse workforce, innovation by creating ideas that prove useful and that our world-class team deserves the best software stack money can buy.

At SAP LeanIX we have a Hybrid Work Mode which means you work remotely from your home office and work from one of our offices. SAP LeanIX teams and team members decide together on the work mode which suits them best. Next to that, we have great benefits for you,

Please check our Applicant Privacy Notice available for more information about how we process your personal data. If you have any questions or concerns about privacy or want to exercise any of your data privacy rights, please send an email to .

All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on experience, qualifications, and competencies. Apply now! Your application will of course be treated confidentially.

title: Mid-Range / Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer (f/m/x)
description:
Hi! We are verkstedt. üëã

We are a team of software developers, located in the heart of Berlin and in Cologne.

We are passionate about delivering high quality web applications with a strong focus on performance, scalability and robust solutions that don‚Äôt bother us during a nice board game session on a Saturday night.

Currently we are looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to join our team. To us this is a very special and quite crucial role. It includes coding as well as building and running infrastructure ‚Äì and communication, which is also an important part of it.

Join us and become part of a seasoned team of skilled engineers!

We offer you the opportunity to shape and evolve large-scale software projects, work flexibly and focus on code, not bureaucracy.

Tasks

  • Setting up and maintaining our cloud infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) with Terraform, Kubernetes, Cloud Run
  • Exploring and evaluating new tools and services
  • Supporting the team with infrastructure and ideas on how to run things in a pragmatic yet robust way.
  • Contributing to open source projects.
  • Working on greenfield projects.

If this sounds like what you are looking for, get in touch! ‚Äì We look forward to meeting you.

Requirements

Basically there is only one major requirement we have: you should simply enjoy building great applications and infrastrcture, writing robust and clean code!

If you can combine this with some significant experience with building Cloud Setups using Terraform and Kubernetes on GCP (or a similar stack that allows you to build great web applications) we‚Äôre very interested to meet for a coffee! üòä

Apart from that, since we‚Äôre a small team and we strongly believe that software development is a team sport and it is important for you to be self organised and not afraid of interacting with other human beings.

This also includes a strong ability to find pragmatic solutions for complex problems and being able to accept that there are always multiple ways to achieve a given goal.

For us this also includes, that no one should be afraid of failures. As a team we only should try not to repeat them.

You should also be able to speak English fluently (and from time to time it can come in handy to speak a few words in German).

Benefits

  • a competitive salary,
  • flexible working hours,
  • homeoffice,
  • time for working on Open Source projects during our regular Open Fridays and
  • you can choose the gear you like.

Coding means hard work, so we always make sure to have enough coffee, fruits, Club Mate & snacks in the office and at our place you will also find:

  • regular Board Game evenings for those interested,
  • Team events and offsites.

Great! Simply fill in the application form below and we will get in touch within a week.

What we then usually do is to start with a quick chat via Google Meet (or whatever channel works) to get to know each other and for you to ask any question that might come to mind.

If we all agree to proceed we would invite you for a coding challenge or a pairing session, which allows us to have a second more indepth discussion with you about your work. ‚Äì And you also get to know us a bit more.

And that‚Äôs basically all the application process there is.

title: Piping Stress and Layout Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Which tasks do you take over?

You will be our all-around genius who understands our and our customer's technology. You'll analyze the customer's system, plan and design piping and duct systems that connect to our high performance storage system. You will support our team - skills that will perfectly contribute to our growth strategy!

Tasks

  • You will calculate plan and design piping and ducts for high temperature applications.
  • You support the project management in the areas of piping and plant design.
  • You create draft piping layouts and detailed design taking into account installation aspects and technical guidelines as well as process requirements according to P&ID and PFD.
  • You perform static analyses of piping systems for different load cases.
  • You prepare drawings for your own designs and sketches using AutoCAD 2D.
  • You design and create standard drawings of pipe supports.
  • You maintain and create technical records and documentation.

Requirements

  • You have a degree in mechanical engineering , plant engineering or similar.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in the field of piping design and construction
  • You have very good experience in dealing with American and European norms and standards such as ASME B31.3 and EN 13480-3, Pressure Equipment Directive (PED) and AD 2000.
  • You have sound knowledge in the use of CAESAR II software and the interpretation of stress results.
  • You have several years of experience in the field of piping and plant design and in dealing with critical media such as steam, compressed gases and oil systems.
  • You bring a high degree of personal responsibility and you are able to work both in a team and independently.
  • You are characterized by a goal-oriented, motivated way of working with a quick analytical grasp.
  • You have a very good command of German and English.

Benefits

  • Permanent employment contract! We focus on a long-term cooperation and want you to become an integral part of our team.
  • Home office and flexible working hours! Hereby we want to enable you the optimal alternation between work and life.
  • Company pension plan! Together with our contractual partner, you can choose which option suits you best.
  • Individual further development! Thanks to a wide range of promotion and development opportunities as well as special skills training, all doors are open to you and we can help you realize your individual career path.
  • Flat hierarchies! A motivating work environment with short decision-making processes is extremely important to us. Contribute your ideas right from the start and actively shape our development.
  • No boredom guaranteed! Personal responsibility, trust and varied tasks are not standard phrases for us.
  • Look forward to your team! A healthy team atmosphere is also important to us outside of work. Through regular company events, we as Kraftblock continue to grow together.
  • You can also look forward to an international and innovative workplace that is just waiting to be developed further with your ideas.

Does this sound like it was made for you? Then apply to us now with your complete application documents.

We look forward to receiving your application!

About us

At Kraftblock, our goal is to enable the transition to renewable energy. Kraftblock has a key technology to decarbonize the industry and is backed by world-class investors with a track record of supporting disruptive technology startups. Now we are looking for highly talented and visionary people who share our passion and drive to develop Kraftblock into the world's leading energy storage system. Join the "Top Innovator" and shape the future of the climate-friendly energy market!

title: Technical Project Manager - Shenzhen Based
description:
Bragi was founded in 2013 and launched the world's first Truly Wireless Earphones in 2015 (yes, a whole 12 months before the Airpods...)

Since then, We have evolved from a promising startup to a market-moving creator of innovative technology, opening the new category of Truly Wireless Earphones. Bragi transformed into a software enabler for consumer brands, focusing on scaling its technology after investing more than $90 million in software and AI.

Now we are a leader in the AI headphone space, known for our smart devices that integrate seamlessly into users' lives. With a focus on innovation and user experience, we are driving the evolution of wearable technology.

Technical Project Manager - Shenzhen Based

This is a remote role based in Shenzhen, China. This is lead position and essential for building up Bragi R&D in China

Tasks

  • Lead a cross functional development team of embedded, mobile and QA engineers located in China
  • Communicate project status, risks, and dependencies to stakeholders at all levels, including executives
  • Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies

  • Team Leading tasks:
  1. Development support to SoC vendors integrating and extending their offering to include Bragi core functionality and AI Applications
  2. Lead and manage multiple, concurrent customer projects focused on customizations and integrations of our hearable products

  • Requirements analysis :

  • Feature support of a SoC vendor

  • Identify gaps between the vendors offering and Bragi's support and vise versa in close collaboration with the product manager and your counterparts in Europe

  • Design, implement and improve the support processes (documentation, tooling)

  • Support ODMs and test engineers (ODM, at Bragi) as part of the "Bragi certification program"

  • Drive our projects by ensuring delivery meets requirements, schedule, budget, scope, and quality criteria including coordination of external partners (customers, suppliers, contractors)

  • Ensure customer expectations are met or exceeded in timely updates, clear communication and quality deliverables

Requirements

  • +8 years experience as a technical project manager
  • Strong leadership, organization, and team management skills
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into clear business terms for stakeholders
  • Experience in working with either of the following chipset vendors: JieLi, WuQi, Actions, Bluetrum, BES, Qualcomm, Airoha
  • Experience with production processes and support
  • Native Mandarin speaker with strong English reading and writing skills (suitable for engineering work), and a decent level of spoken English is mandatory

Nice to have

  • Prior experience as either embedded or mobile developer
  • Exposure to Bluetooth or other wireless communications protocols
  • Exposure to Android or iOS mobile development

Benefits

  • A complex project that is exceptionally challenging and will change how audio is consumed forever
  • Work hand in hand with worldwide known audio brands
  • A chance to deliver a delightful experience to 25m+ users in the next 12 months (existing base is 7m+)
  • A flexible Learning & Development program, choose where you want to improve yourself
  • 10 professional coaching sessions with experts to support your growth

title: Senior Content Marketing Manager & Copywriter (English Speaking) (w/m/d)
description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About the role: 

We seek an experienced, English-speaking Senior Content Marketing Manager & Copywriter to join our commercial unit as part of the Billie Marketing team. In your role, you will be a crucial partner to our Acquisition, Partner, and Product teams. In this position, you will play a central role in shaping the way our audience receives Billie and its products and how we communicate with them. You will be responsible for creating, maintaining and managing a wide variety of compelling and engaging copy and content for different channels and formats, from social, web and product copy to print, long copy, and display advertising. We seek a creative mind with solid writing and content marketing skills and a profound understanding of the B2B e-commerce market, the payments, and the tech landscape.

Your main responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders from Sales, Product and other teams to execute our content strategy by creating and managing compelling content and copy that engages with our audience while aligning with our brand, content, and SEO guidelines.
  • Support our Sales and Acquisition teams with creative copies tailored to our audience to make their campaigns a success. This includes different formats across all our owned, earned, and paid channels, including our website, social media, landing pages, blog, ads, emails, etc. 
  • Write highly curated and differentiated content, such as white papers or other long-copy formats, that is well-researched and educates our audience about the business problems and solutions space we are operating in. Position Billie as a thought leader and pioneer within B2B payments and e-commerce. 
  • Participate in updating our tone of voice guidelines and content style guide and handle content localization for marketing and product-managing freelance translators.
  • Handle and manage all our content marketing via our website, content gating, email flows and other distribution channels. 
  • Own, maintain and grow our social media presence. 

Who we are looking for: 

  • You have 5+ years of experience creating content and copy as part of marketing teams, ideally operating in the B2B space with a focus on enterprise customers or a related discipline.
  • You have a significant background writing for fintechs or the financial industry and a good understanding of Growth and Marketing.
  • You hold a translation, creative writing, journalism, or literature degree or have corresponding professional experience.
  • You are a native speaker of English with excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), a strong grasp of spelling and grammar, and a very strong attention to detail.
  • You are able to write in a variety of styles and have an ear for modern, conversational, and inclusive language. 
  • You have a proven track record and portfolio of work that demonstrates high-quality content for marketing, sales and product teams that customers like.
  • You know how to integrate SEO into your copies when needed and are used to following style, tone, and voice guidelines while delivering results on time. 
  • You know how to work independently in an agile and creative environment while enjoying collaborating with your colleagues.
  • You are a self-starter familiar with typical content tools such as Contentful, ahrefs, ReadMe, Prismic, Phrase, and the whole Google Suite is a big plus. 
  • Experience in localization and translation management is a plus. 
  • You are highly organized and bring excellent project management skills. You have a successful track record of project delivery and pay close attention to detail to ensure flawless quality. Experience working directly with designers and content managers is a plus.
  • You have a highly collaborative approach, excellent stakeholder management skills, and a positive attitude. You are capable of building trust with your team and fellow colleagues, yet you are also capable of working independently, owning projects from ideation to final delivery/implementation.
  • You have professional English proficiency and excellent verbal and written communication skills. Any other European language is a plus.

What we offer:

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our "Catch a Ride with Billie" program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You'll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

title: (Senior) Project Manager ‚Äì Network Planning (m/f/d)
description:
We're looking for a motivated and driven (Senior) Project Manager ‚Äì Network Planning (m/f/d) who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Network Planning Department - the architect of our business, collaborating closely with commercial functions, business development and operations to design the network, allocate bus types, manage timetables, and drive efficiencies.

This is a key role responsible for driving the successful execution and implementation of our Network Planning projects. You will collaborate cross-functionally (with NP business teams, NP Business owner, and non-NP teams) to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. The Project Manager will play a crucial role in in enhancing NP process unification, improving efficiency, and contributing to the overall success of our network planning initiatives.

Your Tasks ‚Äì Paint the world green

Project Planning and Execution:

  • Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, resource allocation, and budgets.
  • Lead the execution of projects, ensuring alignment with strategic goals and objectives.
  • Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and adjust plans as needed.
  • Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholders.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Collaborate with teams across the organization, including network planning, business development, operations, revenue management and IT.
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment and support for projects.
  • Facilitate team meetings and progress check-ins.
  • Manage communication between teams and stakeholders.

Reporting & Documentation:

  • Track progress and update project dashboard
  • Maintain clear documentation of milestones and key decisions
  • Gather and analyse data to track project performance and identify areas for improvement.
  • Prepare regular reports on project status, key metrics, and insights.

Customer Focus:

  • Maintain a strong focus on customer needs and expectations throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Ensure projects deliver measurable improvements in customer satisfaction

Development of solution:

  • Lead brainstorming sessions and workshops to generate solutions for various work streams
  • Use data to drive decision-making and optimize project outcomes.
  • Conduct post-project evaluation and gather feedback

Your Profile ‚Äì Ready to hop on board

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, economics or business administration.
  • Knowledge of the business and network planning processes is a plus.
  • Demonstrated track record of managing complex projects from inception to completion.

Skills:

  • Strong project management skills, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and risk management.
  • Knowledge of PM software and tools (Jira, Asana, MS Project) is a plus
  • Knowledge of Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, and hybrid methodologies is a plus
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships across the organization.
  • Time and Task Management: Prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines, efficient scheduling, workflow optimization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather and interpret data to drive decision-making, decision making under pressure

Abilities:

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Results-oriented and driven to achieve success.

Our Perks ‚Äì More than just a job

  • You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.‚Äã
  • Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
  • Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
  • Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
  • We're not only green in color. We're building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
  • Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!  We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. #LI-Hybrid

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

title: Working Student Social Media Assistant (m/f/x)
description:
Atolls is the world's largest community-driven shopping platform, active in over 20 markets worldwide.

After rebranding from Global Savings Group to Atolls, we've grown from a coupon provider into a global powerhouse, empowering consumers at every step of their shopping journeys. As a trusted destination, we help millions make smarter, more rewarding spending decisions through savings, cashback, deals, product inspiration, and reviews. Our mission is to support consumers from Anywhere to Purchase (A to P), making shopping simpler, smarter, and more enjoyable.

Our team of over 1,000 colleagues, representing 70 nationalities across 10 countries, works together to build digital products that transform the shopping experience. We foster a culture of innovation, learning, and collaboration, giving you the opportunity to grow, lead, and make meaningful contributions. Whether you're shaping products or improving user experiences, you'll be empowered to leave your mark and drive real impact.

Joining Atolls means becoming part of a global team that is constantly evolving and creating platforms relied on by millions of users for confident, seamless shopping experiences.

 

About this role : 

We are looking for a Working Student Social Media Assistant in Berlin to support and strengthen our Marketing team for the Dutch market by posting, and optimizing content across our platforms to increase reach and app retention.

This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with passionate professionals who are shaping the future of shopping. At Atolls, you'll be empowered to grow, innovate, and contribute to meaningful projects that have a real impact.

  • This is a 20-hour-per-week (including weekends), allows you to  from our Berlin headquarters and remotely.  


Responsibilities: 

  • Share the best bargains on social media, primarily Instagram, to engage and inform our audience.
  • Create and post daily stories on Instagram and Facebook to share the best deals on our Instagram and Facebook pages (stories & posts)
  • Optimize reach across various social media platforms and maximize engagement.
  • Analyse content performance on all our social media channels.
  • Work on retention campaigns for our own platform.
  • Help to create and produce engaging content for our channels.
  • Communicate with followers, providing support and fostering communication.


Your Profile : 

  • Motivated to start / grow on your Marketing journey
  • Passion for shopping and deals
  • Experience in the field of marketing
  • Knowledge of - and experience with - Facebook and Instagram, other platforms is a plus! 
  • Eye for design and experience with relevant tools, programs
  • Strong in communication, humorous and thoughtful
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Dutch! 

 

Bonus points: 

  • Previous experience with Metabase!
  • Fluent in Spanish

 

Conditions and working times:

  • Available to work max 20 hours a week, including weekends.


Our Benefits:

At Atolls, we believe in creating an environment that supports both your personal and professional growth. Here's what you can expect as part of our team:

    ‚Ä¢    A culture that values your individual journey and provides opportunities for internal mobility.
    ‚Ä¢    An open-minded team that welcomes new ideas, perspectives, and creative solutions.
    ‚Ä¢    A flexible hybrid working scheme to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
    ‚Ä¢    Access to a learning budget and internal training programs to help you develop new skills and grow in your role.
    ‚Ä¢    Mental health coaching to support your well-being.
    ‚Ä¢    Regular opportunities to participate in global and local get-togethers, building connections with teams across the world.
    ‚Ä¢    A cloud-based work environment that supports flexibility, whether you're working from home or on-site.

 

Are you up for it?

Heads up! To make our process smoother, please apply to a maximum of three roles that best match your fit. This helps us focus on finding the right opportunity for you. Thanks! 

We're looking forward to receiving your CV in English. 

#LI-RB1

At Atolls, we want to ensure that all employees can thrive in an inclusive environment. Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. We remain committed to a culture of diversity, equity and belonging, where all employees are welcomed, respected, connected, and engaged.
